ospf-neighbor-state.c

00001 #include <ospf.h>
00002 
00003 /*
00004         Note: if there are multiple links to neighbor, neighbor will
00005         originate another LSA and send it to us, as will we.  So it
00006         doesn't matter that I am taking down this neighbor when only
00007         one of the links change status between 2 routers/areas.
00008 */
00009 
00010 void
00011 ospf_nbr_reset(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00012 {
00013         rn_machine      *m;
00014         rn_area         *ar;
00015 
00016         ospf_lsa        *lsa;
00017         int              id;
00018 
00019         m = nbr->router->m;
00020         nbr->state = ospf_nbr_down_st;
00021         nbr->inactivity_timer = ospf_timer_cancel(nbr->inactivity_timer, lp);
00022 
00023         nbr->retrans_accum = 0;
00024         nbr->next_retransmit = -1;
00025         nbr->retrans_timer = NULL;
00026         nbr->flood = NULL;
00027         nbr->dd_seqnum = tw_rand_integer(lp->rng, 0, INT_MAX);
00028 
00029         ar = rn_getarea(rn_getmachine(lp->id));
00030         if(ar == rn_getarea(nbr->m))
00031                 id = nbr->id - ar->low;
00032         else if(ar->as == rn_getas(nbr->m))
00033                 id = ar->nmachines + nbr->ar->id - rn_getas(nbr->m)->low;
00034         else
00035                 id = ar->nmachines + ar->as->nareas + rn_getas(nbr->m)->id;
00036 
00037         // Remove the neighbor LSA
00038         ospf_db_remove(nbr->router, id, lp);
00039 
00040         // Remove any other LSAs originated by this neighbor ..
00041         for(id = ar->nmachines; id < ar->g_ospf_nlsa; id++)
00042         {
00043                 lsa = getlsa(nbr->router->m, nbr->router->db[id].lsa, id);
00044 
00045                 if(m->link[m->ft[lsa->adv_r]].addr == nbr->id)
00046                 {
00047                         ospf_lsa_flush(nbr->router, nbr, &nbr->router->db[id], lp);
00048                         ospf_db_remove(nbr->router, id, lp);
00049                 }
00050         }
00051 
00052         ospf_rt_build(nbr->router, lp->id);
00053 }

00055 void
00056 ospf_nbr_reset_rc(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00057 {
00058         tw_error(TW_LOC, "Unable to rollback nbr state yet!");
00059         //nbr->state = nbr->rc_state;
00060 }
00061 
00062 /*
00063 
00064 An adjacency should be established with a bidirectional neighbor
00065         when at least one of the following conditions holds:
00066 
00067         o   The underlying network type is point-to-point
00068 
00069         o   The underlying network type is Point-to-MultiPoint
00070 
00071         o   The underlying network type is virtual link
00072 
00073         o   The router itself is the Designated Router
00074 
00075         o   The router itself is the Backup Designated Router
00076 
00077         o   The neighboring router is the Designated Router
00078 
00079         o   The neighboring router is the Backup Designated Router
00080 */
00081 
00082 /*
00083  * Only working with p2p right now, so this is
00084  * always returning true
00085  */
00086 int
00087 ospf_nbr_establish_adjacency(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00088 {
00089         return 1;
00090 }
00091 
00092 /*
00093 State(s):  Exchange
00094 
00095             Event:  ExchangeDone
00096 
00097         New state:  Depends upon action routine.
00098 
00099            Action:  If the neighbor Link state request list is empty,
00100                     the new neighbor state is Full.  No other action is
00101                     required.  This is an adjacency's final state.
00102 
00103                     Otherwise, the new neighbor state is Loading.  Start
00104                     (or continue) sending Link State Request packets to
00105                     the neighbor (see Section 10.9).  These are requests
00106                     for the neighbor's more recent LSAs (which were
00107                     discovered but not yet received in the Exchange
00108                     state).  These LSAs are listed in the Link state
00109                     request list associated with the neighbor.
00110 
00111 */
00112 
00113 void
00114 ospf_nbr_exchange_done(ospf_state * state, ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00115 {
00116         if(nbr->nrequests == 0)
00117         {
00118                 nbr->state = ospf_nbr_full_st;
00119 
00120                 if(nbr->ar == nbr->router->ar)
00121                 {
00122                         //state->stats->s_cause_ospf++;
00123                         ospf_lsa_create(state, nbr, 
00124                                         lp->id - state->m->subnet->area->low, lp);
00125                 } else
00126                 {
00127                         //state->stats->s_cause_ospf++;
00128                         ospf_lsa_create(nbr->router, nbr, 
00129                                 rn_getarea(nbr->m)->id + 
00130                                 nbr->router->m->subnet->area->nmachines, lp);
00131                 }
00132 
00133                 printf("%lld: Exchange done: nbr %d full \n", lp->id, nbr->id);
00134 
00135                 // Cancel the retrans timer now that I have recv'd the 
00136                 // response to my LS_REQUEST
00137                 nbr->retrans_timer = ospf_timer_cancel(nbr->retrans_timer, lp);
00138         } else
00139         {
00140                 nbr->state = ospf_nbr_loading_st;
00141 
00142                 ospf_ls_request(state, nbr, lp);
00143 
00144                 printf("%lld: Exchange done: nbr %d loading \n", lp->id, nbr->id);
00145         }
00146 }
00147 
00148 /*
00149  * Set the state to attempt from down, and set the inactive timer
00150  */
00151 void
00152 ospf_nbr_start(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00153 {
00154         if (nbr->state == ospf_nbr_down_st)
00155         {
00156                 printf("%lld: setting nbr %d to attempt!\n", lp->id, nbr->id);
00157                 nbr->state = ospf_nbr_attempt_st;
00158         }
00159 
00160         nbr->inactivity_timer =
00161                 ospf_timer_start(nbr, nbr->inactivity_timer, nbr->router_dead_interval,
00162                                                  OSPF_HELLO_TIMEOUT, lp);
00163 }
00164 
00165 /*
00166 State(s):  Any state
00167 
00168             Event:  InactivityTimer
00169 
00170         New state:  Down
00171 
00172            Action:  The Link state retrans_timermission list, Database summary
00173                     list and Link state request list are cleared of
00174                     LSAs.
00175 */
00176 
00177 void
00178 ospf_nbr_inactivity_timer(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00179 {
00180 #if VERIFY_LS
00181         printf("%ld OSPF: removing nbr %d from full st, HELLO timeout!\n",
00182                         lp->id, nbr->id);
00183 #endif
00184 
00185 
00186         if (nbr->state == ospf_nbr_full_st)
00187         {
00188                 nbr->state = ospf_nbr_down_st;
00189 
00190                 // this will also rebuild routing table for me..
00191                 if(nbr->ar == nbr->router->ar)
00192                 {
00193                         ospf_lsa_create(nbr->router, nbr, 
00194                                 lp->id - nbr->router->m->subnet->area->low, lp);
00195                 } else
00196                 {
00197                         ospf_lsa_create(nbr->router, nbr, 
00198                                 rn_getarea(nbr->m)->id + 
00199                                 nbr->router->m->subnet->area->nmachines - 
00200                                 nbr->router->m->subnet->area->as->low, lp);
00201                 }
00202 
00203                 ospf_nbr_reset(nbr, lp);
00204         } else
00205                 ospf_nbr_reset(nbr, lp);
00206 }
00207 
00208 void
00209 ospf_nbr_inactivity_timer_rc(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_bf * bf, tw_lp * lp)
00210 {
00211         ospf_nbr_reset_rc(nbr, lp);
00212 
00213         if(bf->c1 == 1)
00214         {
00215                 //ospf_lsa_create_rc(nbr->router, nbr, lp->id - nbr->router->m->subnet->area->low, lp);
00216         }
00217 }

00219 /*
00220 State(s):  Any state
00221 
00222             Event:  KillNbr
00223 
00224         New state:  Down
00225 
00226            Action:  The Link state retrans_timermission list, Database summary
00227                     list and Link state request list are cleared of
00228                     LSAs.  Also, the Inactivity Timer is disabled.
00229 */
00230 
00231 void
00232 ospf_nbr_kill_nbr(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00233 {
00234         //printf("%ld: KILLING NBR %d !!! \n", lp->id, nbr->id);
00235         ospf_nbr_reset(nbr, lp);
00236 }

00238 
00239 /*
00240 State(s):  2-Way or greater
00241 
00242             Event:  1-WayReceived
00243 
00244         New state:  Init
00245 
00246            Action:  The Link state retrans_timermission list, Database summary
00247                     list and Link state request list are cleared of
00248                     LSAs.
00249 */
00250 
00251 void
00252 ospf_nbr_one_way_recv(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00253 {
00254         if (nbr->state >= ospf_nbr_two_way_st)
00255                 nbr->state = ospf_nbr_init_st;
00256 }
00257 
00258 /*
00259 State(s):  Any state
00260 
00261             Event:  LLDown
00262 
00263         New state:  Down
00264 
00265            Action:  The Link state retrans_timermission list, Database summary
00266                     list and Link state request list are cleared of
00267                     LSAs.  Also, the Inactivity Timer is disabled.
00268 */
00269 
00270 void
00271 ospf_nbr_ll_down(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00272 {
00273         ospf_nbr_reset(nbr, lp);
00274 }
00275 
00276 /*
00277 
00278          State(s):  Attempt
00279 
00280             Event:  HelloReceived
00281 
00282         New state:  Init
00283 
00284            Action:  Restart the Inactivity Timer for the neighbor, since
00285                     the neighbor has now been heard from.
00286 */
00287 
00288 void
00289 ospf_nbr_hello_recv(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00290 {
00291         switch (nbr->state)
00292         {
00293         case ospf_nbr_attempt_st:
00294         case ospf_nbr_down_st:
00295                 nbr->state = ospf_nbr_init_st;
00296 
00297                 /*
00298                  * all other states 
00299                  */
00300         default:
00301 
00302                 nbr->inactivity_timer =
00303                         ospf_timer_start(nbr, nbr->inactivity_timer,
00304                                          nbr->router_dead_interval,
00305                                          OSPF_HELLO_TIMEOUT, lp);
00306         }
00307 }
00308 
00309 /*
00310         New state:  Depends upon action routine.
00311 
00312            Action:  Determine whether an adjacency should be established
00313                     with the neighbor (see Section 10.4).  If not, the
00314                     new neighbor state is 2-Way.
00315 
00316                     Otherwise (an adjacency should be established) the
00317                     neighbor state transitions to ExStart.  Upon
00318                     entering this state, the router increments the DD
00319                     sequence number in the neighbor data structure.  If
00320                     this is the first time that an adjacency has been
00321                     attempted, the DD sequence number should be assigned
00322                     some unique value (like the time of day clock).  It
00323                     then declares itself master (sets the master/slave
00324                     bit to master), and starts sending Database
00325                     Description Packets, with the initialize (I), more
00326                     (M) and master (MS) bits set.  This Database
00327                     Description Packet should be otherwise empty.  This
00328                     Database Description Packet should be retransmitted
00329                     at intervals of RxmtInterval until the next state is
00330                     entered (see Section 10.8).
00331 */
00332 
00333 void
00334 ospf_nbr_two_way_recv(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00335 {
00336         tw_event        *e;
00337         tw_memory       *b;
00338         ospf_dd_pkt     *dd;
00339 
00340         if (nbr->state != ospf_nbr_init_st)
00341                 return;
00342 
00343         if (ospf_nbr_establish_adjacency(nbr, lp))
00344         {
00345                 // send dd pkt
00346                 b = tw_memory_alloc(lp, g_ospf_dd_fd);
00347                 dd = tw_memory_data(b);
00348 
00349                 nbr->state = ospf_nbr_exstart_st;
00350                 nbr->master = 0;
00351 
00352                 dd->b.init = 1;
00353                 dd->b.more = 1;
00354                 dd->b.master = 1;
00355                 dd->seqnum = ++nbr->dd_seqnum;
00356                 dd->nlsas = 0;
00357 
00358                 nbr->retrans_dd = ospf_dd_copy(b, lp);
00359 
00360                 e = ospf_event_new(nbr->router, tw_getlp(nbr->id), 0.0, lp);
00361                 ospf_event_send(nbr->router, e, OSPF_DD_MSG,
00362                                 lp, OSPF_DD_HEADER, b, nbr->router->ar->id);
00363 
00364                 printf("%lld OSPF: send ExStart to %d, %lf: I %d, M %d, Master %d \n",
00365                         lp->id, nbr->id, e->recv_ts, dd->b.init, dd->b.more, dd->b.master);
00366 
00367                 nbr->retrans_timer =
00368                         ospf_timer_start(nbr, nbr->retrans_timer,
00369                                                 OSPF_RETRANS_INTERVAL, 
00370                                                 OSPF_RETRANS_TIMEOUT, 
00371                                                 lp);
00372         } else
00373         {
00374                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Only simulating broadcast networks!");
00375         }
00376 }
00377 
00378 /*
00379          State(s):  ExStart
00380 
00381             Eventid :  NegotiationDone
00382 
00383         New state:  Exchange
00384 
00385            Action:  The router must list the contents of its entire area
00386                     link state database in the neighbor Database summary
00387                     list.  The area link state database consists of the
00388                     router-LSAs, network-LSAs and summary-LSAs contained
00389                     in the area structure, along with the AS-external-
00390                     LSAs contained in the global structure.  AS-
00391                     external-LSAs are omitted from a virtual neighbor's
00392                     Database summary list.  AS-external-LSAs are omitted
00393                     from the Database summary list if the area has been
00394                     configured as a stub (see Section 3.6).  LSAs whose
00395                     age is equal to MaxAge are instead added to the
00396                     neighbor's Link state retrans_timermission list.  A
00397                     summary of the Database summary list will be sent to
00398                     the neighbor in Database Description packets.  Each
00399                     Database Description Packet has a DD sequence
00400                     number, and is explicitly acknowledged.  Only one
00401                     Database Description Packet is allowed outstanding
00402                     at any one time.  For more detail on the sending and
00403                     receiving of Database Description packets, see
00404                     Sections 10.8 and 10.6.
00405 */
00406 void
00407 ospf_nbr_neg_done(ospf_state * state, ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00408 {
00409         tw_event        *e;
00410         tw_memory       *b;
00411 
00412         ospf_dd_pkt     *dd;
00413 
00414         if (nbr->state != ospf_nbr_exstart_st)
00415                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Invalid state for nbr_neg_done!");
00416 
00417         nbr->state = ospf_nbr_exchange_st;
00418 
00419         // master must wait for slave to reply with master's seqnum
00420         if(0 == nbr->master)
00421                 return;
00422 
00423         // send dd pkt
00424         b = tw_memory_alloc(lp, g_ospf_dd_fd);
00425         dd = tw_memory_data(b);
00426 
00427         dd->b.init = 0;
00428         dd->b.more = 1;
00429 
00430         if(nbr->master)
00431         {
00432                 //nbr->dd_seqnum++;
00433                 dd->b.master = 0;
00434         } else
00435                 dd->b.master = 1;
00436 
00437         dd->seqnum = nbr->dd_seqnum;
00438         dd->nlsas = 0;
00439 
00440         e = ospf_event_new(nbr->router, tw_getlp(nbr->id), 0.0, lp);
00441         ospf_event_send(nbr->router, e, OSPF_DD_MSG, lp, 
00442                         OSPF_DD_HEADER, b, nbr->router->ar->id);
00443 
00444         printf("%lld OSPF: send Exchange to %d %lf, seqnum %d, nbr %d master %d \n",
00445                 lp->id, nbr->id, e->recv_ts, dd->seqnum, nbr->id, nbr->master);
00446 
00447         nbr->retrans_dd = ospf_dd_copy(b, lp);
00448 
00449         nbr->retrans_timer =
00450                         ospf_timer_start(nbr, nbr->retrans_timer,
00451                                                 OSPF_RETRANS_INTERVAL, 
00452                                                 OSPF_RETRANS_TIMEOUT, 
00453                                                 lp);
00454 }
00455 
00456 /*
00457 
00458          State(s):  2-Way
00459 
00460             Event:  AdjOK?
00461 
00462         New state:  Depends upon action routine.
00463 
00464            Action:  Determine whether an adjacency should be formed with
00465                     the neighboring router (see Section 10.4).  If not,
00466                     the neighbor state remains at 2-Way.  Otherwise,
00467                     transition the neighbor state to ExStart and perform
00468                     the actions associated with the above state machine
00469                     entry for state Init and event 2-WayReceived.
00470 
00471 
00472          State(s):  ExStart or greater
00473 
00474             Event:  AdjOK?
00475 
00476         New state:  Depends upon action routine.
00477 
00478            Action:  Determine whether the neighboring router should
00479                     still be adjacent.  If yes, there is no state change
00480                     and no further action is necessary.
00481 
00482                     Otherwise, the (possibly partially formed) adjacency
00483                     must be destroyed.  The neighbor state transitions
00484                     to 2-Way.  The Link state retrans_timermission list,
00485                     Database summary list and Link state request list
00486                     are cleared of LSAs.
00487 
00488 */
00489 
00490 void
00491 ospf_nbr_adj_ok(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00492 {
00493         if (nbr->state == ospf_nbr_two_way_st)
00494         {
00495                 if (ospf_nbr_establish_adjacency(nbr, lp))
00496                 {
00497                         nbr->state = ospf_nbr_init_st;
00498                         ospf_nbr_two_way_recv(nbr, lp);
00499                 }
00500         } else if (nbr->state >= ospf_nbr_exstart_st)
00501         {
00502                 if (ospf_nbr_establish_adjacency(nbr, lp))
00503                         return;
00504 
00505                 nbr->state = ospf_nbr_two_way_st;
00506         }
00507 }
00508 
00509 /*
00510 
00511          State(s):  Exchange or greater
00512 
00513             Event:  SeqNumberMismatch
00514 
00515         New state:  ExStart
00516 
00517            Action:  The (possibly partially formed) adjacency is torn
00518                     down, and then an attempt is made at
00519                     reestablishment.  The neighbor state first
00520                     transitions to ExStart.  The Link state
00521                     retransmission list, Database summary list and Link
00522                     state request list are cleared of LSAs.  Then the
00523                     router increments the DD sequence number in the
00524                     neighbor data structure, declares itself master
00525                     (sets the master/slave bit to master), and starts
00526                     sending Database Description Packets, with the
00527                     initialize (I), more (M) and master (MS) bits set.
00528                     This Database Description Packet should be otherwise
00529                     empty (see Section 10.8).
00530 */
00531 void
00532 ospf_nbr_seqnum_mismatch(ospf_nbr * nbr, tw_lp * lp)
00533 {
00534         nbr->state = ospf_nbr_init_st;
00535         ospf_nbr_two_way_recv(nbr, lp);
00536 
00537         tw_error(TW_LOC, "Should not be getting mismatched seqnums on DD pkts!");
00538 }
00539 
00540 /*
00541  * Process nbr events
00542  */
00543 void
00544 ospf_nbr_event_handler(ospf_state * state, ospf_nbr * nbr, ospf_nbr_event event, tw_lp * lp)
00545 {
00546         switch (event)
00547         {
00548         case ospf_nbr_hello_recv_ev:
00549                 ospf_nbr_hello_recv(nbr, lp);
00550                 break;
00551         case ospf_nbr_start_ev:
00552                 ospf_nbr_start(nbr, lp);
00553                 break;
00554         case ospf_nbr_one_way_ev:
00555                 ospf_nbr_one_way_recv(nbr, lp);
00556                 break;
00557         case ospf_nbr_two_way_recv_ev:
00558                 ospf_nbr_two_way_recv(nbr, lp);
00559                 break;
00560         case ospf_nbr_neg_done_ev:
00561                 ospf_nbr_neg_done(state, nbr, lp);
00562                 break;
00563         case ospf_nbr_exchange_done_ev:
00564                 ospf_nbr_exchange_done(state, nbr, lp);
00565                 break;
00566         case ospf_nbr_bad_ls_request_ev:
00567                 if (nbr->state >= ospf_nbr_exchange_st)
00568                         ospf_nbr_seqnum_mismatch(nbr, lp);
00569                 break;
00570         case ospf_nbr_load_done_ev:
00571                 if (nbr->state == ospf_nbr_loading_st)
00572                         nbr->state = ospf_nbr_full_st;
00573 
00574                 printf("%lld: new neighbor at full_st: %d \n", lp->id, nbr->id);
00575                 break;
00576         case ospf_nbr_adj_ok_ev:
00577                 ospf_nbr_adj_ok(nbr, lp);
00578                 break;
00579         case ospf_nbr_seqnum_mismatch_ev:
00580                 ospf_nbr_seqnum_mismatch(nbr, lp);
00581                 break;
00582         case ospf_nbr_kill_nbr_ev:
00583                 ospf_nbr_kill_nbr(nbr, lp);
00584                 break;
00585         case ospf_nbr_inactivity_timer_ev:
00586                 ospf_nbr_inactivity_timer(nbr, lp);
00587                 break;
00588         case rc_ospf_nbr_inactivity_timer_ev:
00589                 ospf_nbr_inactivity_timer(nbr, lp);
00590                 break;
00591         case ospf_nbr_ll_down_ev:
00592                 ospf_nbr_ll_down(nbr, lp);
00593                 break;
00594         default:
00595                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Unknown nbr event: %d", event);
00596         }
00597 }
